Key Match Events: Ronel Blanco threw six scoreless innings
Jason Heyward had a home run among his three hits
Jeremy Peña had two hits and two runs scored
Josh Hader recorded the final two outs for his 31st save in 33 opportunities
Taylor Ward hit a home run and rookie Eric Wagaman had two hits for the Angels
Pre-Game Insights: Ronel Blanco was used out of the bullpen for a game to manage his usage in his first full season in the majors
The Astros won their fourth consecutive game and remained 4 1/2 games ahead of the Seattle Mariners in the American League West
Post-Match Reflections: Ronel Blanco said through an interpreter that the thing that helped him a ton was being able to have that rest before this outing
Jason Heyward said it's nice to have a job with a team competing to win and wanting to win a World Series
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Angels dropped to 60-89, matching their loss total from the 2022 and 2023 seasons
Angels rookie right-hander Caden Dana (1-2) went 3 1/3 innings in his third career start, giving up five runs on five hits with two walks and three strikeouts
Others: Astros OF Ben Gamel was not in the lineup after sustaining a knee contusion in Saturday’s game
Angels OF Mickey Moniak was hit by a pitch on his left hand in the ninth and left the game
